content.description: Sit start with the left hand high on a slopey blob, and the right hand low on another blob. Pinch hard with the left and gaston hard with the right, and make a hard move up right hand to a good hueco. From here make a few moves out right and top out as for "Hero's Roof".
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads. There is an awkward rock behind.
content.location: To the left of "Hero Roof" on obvious sloper blobs.

content.description: Start at obvious bog hold in middle of overhanging face. Heel hooky help. Make big move right to big hold just above the start of Hero Roof.
content.location: Center of Hero Roof Face. Finishes same as Hero Roof

content.description: Kind of a one-mover into easier terrain. Squat start low matched on a grainy dish-like sloper. Find a foot that suits you and execute a powerful dynamic move up to a good edge in a dish. Once here continue up on some friction dependent holds.
content.protection: 2 pads, tape, and a cat box to store all the kitty-litter in.
content.location: This is the low start into "Groovy Grit". From "Hero Roof" walk left and down the hill along the boulder to an obvious dish starting hold.

content.description:
Start as for "Just Grit" and do the introduction to that problem by sticking a huge move up to a scoop. From here, match hands and head out right on some bad slopers and dishes and finish as for "Dishy Grit".

Which of the three is the better line? "Dishy Grit", "Just Grit", or "Just Dishy"?!
content.location: Same start as "Just Grit" and "Dishy Grit".

content.description:
One of the best warm-ups in the 'Milks.  A couple laps on this will get the blood flowing on those crisp mornings.

Sit-start low on big patina edges on the right side of the overhanging face, then work your way up and left along the lip of the roof on good jugs.  Pull over to a jug on the top.
content.location: On the Hero Roof Boulder, just downhill and west of the Iron Man Boulder.  The roof/overhang faces north.

content.description:
The slopey double arete on the left/east side of the Hero Roof Boulder.  This is a start-extension to 'Easy Grit' v5, substantially upping the grade.

Awaiting consensus on grade.  V9?

Start standing with the right hand low on the right arete and the left hand as for 'Easy Grit'.  It adds one tricky move to 'Easy Grit' and a proper start to the boulder.
content.location: Hero Roof Boulder, left side/east arete.

content.description: Stand start beneath a groove/ scoop. Pull onto the wall and climb direct via some slopers and some opposition on grainy rock.
content.location: From "Easy Grit" follow the boulder left and downhill to an obvious groove before the fence.

content.description:
The slopey double arete on the left side of the Hero Roof Boulder.

Start standing with a high right hand pinch and a left hand on the arete.  Climb up and right on slopers.  Sharp, but good.
content.location: Hero Roof Boulder, left side/east arete.

content.description: Squat start matched on a grainy dish feature with a giant foothold underneath the small roof. Pull onto the wall and trend rightwards using some unique holds. Figuring out where to hold the grooves and slopers is critical. Bring some skin and some stamina, and get on this thing while it is in the shade!
content.location: This hard and unique sloper problem is located down hill from "The Iron Man Traverse". Down and left of "Easy Grit".
